page.title: 12FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (7).
page.content: {Crops. There are seventeen farms and seven farms do not grow any crops at all. So ten farms do grow crops. Altogether they grow three hundred and seventy seven acres of crops. Most of them grow a mixture of crops. Eight farms grow barley, four farms grow some wheat,one farm grows turnips, one farm grows peas, two farms grow potatoes, one farm grows kale, three farms grow corn, one farm grows rape and one farm grows beet for fodder. {Woodland. Out of the seventeen farms only eight had some woodland. Altogether there was one hundred acres of woodland and most of it was pine. Tregeare Estate had the most with 52 acres and West End had only one acre.
